name: Mazagan Beach Resort

reviews.text: Well when we were booking the reviews of this place were excellent, then in Aug 2012 there were a few terrible reviews added.. We were a bit upset as we were very much looking forward to going and had opted for a Sea View Suite...
reviews.title: Excellent Holiday at Mazagan Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: How wrong could those reviews be?! The hotel is just fantastic and the staff are all super friendly..
reviews.title: Aboslutely great! Will def be back!

reviews.text: First thing that I found great was free WIFI everywhere in the hotel, essential to stop your phone bill from sky rocketing these days.
reviews.title: Great Resort, great Beach, great Golf, great Food !

reviews.text: Then I find out the health club is free access... excellent another bonus.
reviews.title: Mazagan Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we got was great, nice and spacious, large double bed and a cot for our infant... Great views over the beach. Very impressed from the beginning.
reviews.title: 5 star resort, 3/4 star or less rooms. Avoid weekends and high season

reviews.text: From making mistakes on our booking to the client service received, this place is just a mess. Would suit any one interested in casino, etc, ... but definitely not a 5 star family resort where attention to details and service should be every staff motto. My wife and I were very annoyed by the lack of competence of the Mazagan Staff. If you ever check in, do make sure you check you bills twice as you might get over charged. Also, rooms on the fifth floor facing the ocean are not outstanding, just average.
reviews.title: Definitely not the promise of a 5 star Venue

reviews.text: Ok lets begin... We booked the Mazagan 5 star hotel as our family holiday this year. We booked directly and this is were our ordeal began. My husband rang to get a quote for our stay and was given a price. I then rang to book the hotel after getting the flight information in order first. The second call I was given completely different prices. My husband then called back again to clarify the situation to be given a third price which was fine. We booked the hoilday and we all were very excited as we have always wanted to visit Morocco. When the e-mail confirmation came through the prices were vastly more expensive per day than what was quoted over the phone. Obviously we then called again the clarify this and they would not back down saying that we must have got it wrong. We had already booked our flights so we couldn't back out. This left us feeling a little angry as we felt royally ripped off.
reviews.title: This is NOT a 5 star hotel!!!

reviews.text: Check in time was 3pm we arrived to the hotel at 5pm. The reception was packed with what seemed like a free for all queuing system. Eventually we got seen and our details were taken. We do not speak Arabic or French so the communication was tough. We were then told that our room was not ready and we could wait in the Atrium bar and we would be given a free drink. After 40 minutes we got our free drink and an hour after that our room was eventually ready. With two children, hand luggage and hungry bellies we finally got to our room. Which I must say was lovely with great sea views.
reviews.title: Do not go with fleetway travel - very annoyed

reviews.text: The market place was busy and canteen like.. not 5 star quality.
reviews.title: Family summer holiday 2012

reviews.text: Out of the 8 restaurants 4 of them close at 5pm, one didnt allow children as its in the casino and depending on how busy the hotel was they may or may not open the others leaving only the canteen style market place to choose from. Not what their website boasts "With many restaurants, bars and lounges, Mazagan is truly a culinary destination from family friendly to fine dining"!!!! This a joke.
reviews.title: DO NOT GO EXPECTING 5*

reviews.text: Hotel itself and the rooms are big, clean and very nice indeed. The problem is simple and should be easy enough to fix. If you are going to market to international market then the staff should be international and have mix of languages. It has been very difficult for us and our children to communicate to general staff as they do not speak English. Only at the senior level at front desk is there a grasp of English.
reviews.title: Mazagan and fleetway Travel

reviews.text: The other thing to be aware of is the information on room type between fleetway and the hotel. Fleetway tell you that you have booked a deluxe ocean view room but when you arrive you find it is only partial ocean view which is naughty. The hotel then move some clients but not others depending on how much you complain. One family got their rooms changed and I just got a platter of fruit and bottle of water sent as apology!
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: When I rang fleetway they tell me that I can see the ocean just about and therefore they won't do anything to help or feel they have been miss leading.
reviews.title: Faultless! Stunning Customer Service!

reviews.text: Be careful with the travel company as they are not one to fully disclose what they have booked for you and be careful of this resort if you do not speak French.
reviews.title: Wow what a place

reviews.text: The transfer is 1.5 hours if you have a baby that is quite a bit of time after a 3.5 hour flight but saying that it went quickly and the return the same. Watch at the airport that the average Joe is not also trying to help with your bags onto the coach. They will want a tip, be a bit street wise and hang on to your baggage unless its the driver in his black suit.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.text: Gorgeous and relaxing setting with great staff and excellent food. I was there for one night for a team building and treated really nicely afterwards by the hotel staff. The pool is wonderful, the rooms are HUGE and the setting is just gorgeous. The food at the hotel is top quality. I would recommend it to anyone that can afford it!
reviews.title: Hotel de luxe!!!!

reviews.text: Mazagan is an excellent luxury resort. Everything was very good. Service, food, rooms, spa, beach and pool were exceptional. Staff are friendly and attentive. The shuttle from CMN airport is very convenient. Coffee was little weak, but you can ask for espresso which solves the problem.
reviews.title: Great time, but too short

reviews.text: Beach was beautiful and empty. I felt like it was my own private island. Ocean was surprisingly cool. The golf course looks nice but I don't play.
reviews.title: Perfect week-end break

reviews.text: Definitely will return, even if it is pricier than a lot of other resorts.
reviews.title: Horriffic service and hygiene

reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at the Mazagan and it was just what we wanted expected. They have a huge and beautiful pool which has the bonus to be heated (except for a few days of highs temperatures tend to be around 20-25 celcius and it was a great bonus to have a heated pool). The pool has sufficient chaises-longues (lounges chairs) and attendants are very courteous and responsive (bring towels, open umbrellas). I did think though that people should not be allowed to 'reserve' their place by leaving a book and then go off to breakfast. The hotel also has a gorgeous private beach (also with nice chaises-longue and attendants) and a kids pool. Although we did not use the baby club we did visit and it looked very professional. The food is a bit average but this is often the case in resorts. We wanted a resort holiday and it was the perfect one. The hotel is expensive but its ammenities live up to the price and make you just want to stay there. If sightseeing is the goal, I would not book the Mazagan but for restful holiday- recommended! I did not rate it with a 5 because I felt that Mazagan lacks in the little polished gestures that make the difference between very good and excellent (the wait at the reception desk for example is too long).
reviews.title: Mazagan? More like "Neveragan"

description: The Mazagan Beach resort is a magical destination combining relaxation, leisure and sports through its infrastructures: Golf, Spa, Casino, Kids Club, restaurants. All the amenities are built to facilitate the stay. The hotel is set in 250 hectares of landscape with a private beach of 7km and features a 180° view over the Atlantic Ocean, a very good recommendation for families (special offers for children rooms), couples & singles. The design of the 500 luxurious and spacious rooms (42 m2), the flavours of Moroccan gastronomy and the Spa ensure you an authentic memorable experience.
